member.name: M:iText.Forms.Fields.PdfFormAnnotation.SetFormFieldElement(iText.Forms.Form.Element.IFormField)
member.summary: This method sets the model element associated with the current annotation and can be useful to take into account when drawing those properties that the annotation does not have.
member.remarks:
This method sets the model element associated with the current annotation and can be useful to take into account when drawing those properties that the annotation does not have. Note that annotation properties will take precedence, so such properties cannot be overridden by using this method (e.g. background, text color, etc.).
Also note that the model element won't be used for annotations for choice form field.
member.param: model element to set.

member.name: T:iText.Forms.Fields.PdfFormFieldMergeUtil
member.summary:
Utility class to merge form fields
with the same names.

member.name: M:iText.Forms.Fields.PdfFormFieldMergeUtil.MergeKidsWithSameNames(iText.Forms.Fields.PdfFormField,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method merges all kids with the same names for the given parent field dictionary (recursively).
member.param: a field whose kids should be checked and merged in case of same partial names.
true if the exception is expected after the merge failed, false if log is expected.

member.name: M:iText.Forms.Fields.PdfFormFieldMergeUtil.MergeTwoFieldsWithTheSameNames(iText.Forms.Fields.PdfFormField,iText.Forms.Fields.PdfFormField,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method merges different values from two field dictionaries into the first one and combines kids.
member.param: a field into which dictionary all values will be merged.
a field whose values should be merged into the first dictionary.
true if the exception is expected after the merge failed, false if log is expected.
member.returns: true if fields is successfully merged, false otherwise.

member.name: M:iText.Forms.Fields.PdfFormFieldMergeUtil.GetPartialName(iText.Forms.Fields.AbstractPdfFormField)
member.summary: Gets partial name for the field dictionary.
member.param: field to get name from.
member.returns: field partial name. Also, null if passed dictionary is a pure widget, empty string in case it is a field with no /T entry.

member.name: M:iText.Forms.Fields.PdfFormFieldMergeUtil.ProcessDirtyAnnotations(iText.Forms.Fields.PdfFormField,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sometimes widgets contain field related keys, and they are the same as these field keys at parent.
member.remarks:
Sometimes widgets contain field related keys, and they are the same as these field keys at parent. During merge process we get something like: ParentField (/DA <DA1> /Ft <Tx> /T <test> /Kids <Field>) -> Field (/DA <DA1> /Kids <Annotation>) -> Annotation (without any form fields)
This method combines ParentField with Field.
member.param: a field whose form field kids should be checked and merged with parent in case all their dictionary values (except Parent and Kids) are the same or parent is a radio button.
true if the exception is expected after the merge failed, false if log is expected.

member.summary: This class represents the static form technology AcroForm on a PDF file.

member.name: F:iText.Forms.PdfAcroForm.SIGNATURE_EXIST
member.summary: To be used with .
member.remarks:
To be used with .
If set, the document contains at least one signature field. This flag allows a conforming reader to enable user interface items (such as menu items or pushbuttons) related to signature processing without having to scan the entire document for the presence of signature fields. (ISO 32000-1, section 12.7.2 "Interactive Form Dictionary")

member.name: F:iText.Forms.PdfAcroForm.APPEND_ONLY
member.summary: To be used with .
member.remarks:
To be used with .
If set, the document contains signatures that may be invalidated if the file is saved (written) in a way that alters its previous contents, as opposed to an incremental update. Merely updating the file by appending new information to the end of the previous version is safe. Conforming readers may use this flag to inform a user requesting a full save that signatures will be invalidated and require explicit confirmation before continuing with the operation. (ISO 32000-1, section 12.7.2 "Interactive Form Dictionary")

to generate an appearance Stream for all form field s that don't have one.

method.

member.summary: A sample implementation of the {#link IPdfPageExtraCopier} interface which copies only AcroForm fields to a new page.
member.remarks:
A sample implementation of the {#link IPdfPageExtraCopier} interface which copies only AcroForm fields to a new page.
NOTE: While it's absolutely not necessary to use the same PdfPageFormCopier instance for copying operations, it is still worth to know that PdfPageFormCopier uses some caching logic which can potentially improve performance in case of the reusing of the same instance.

member.name: T:iText.Forms.Xfdf.IdsObject
member.summary: Represents ids element, child of the xfdf element.
member.remarks: Represents ids element, child of the xfdf element. Corresponds to the ID key in the file dictionary. The two attributes are file identifiers for the source or target file designated by the f element, taken from the ID entry in the files trailer dictionary. Attributes: original, modified. For more details see paragraph 6.2.3 in Xfdf document specification.

member.name: F:iText.Forms.Xfdf.IdsObject.original
member.summary: This attribute corresponds to the permanent identifier which is based on the contents of the file at the time it was originally created.
member.remarks: This attribute corresponds to the permanent identifier which is based on the contents of the file at the time it was originally created. This value does not change when the file is incrementally updated. The value shall be a hexadecimal number. A common value for this is an MD5 checksum.

member.name: F:iText.Forms.Xfdf.IdsObject.modified
member.summary: The attribute contains a unique identifier for the modified version of the pdf and corresponding xfdf document.
member.remarks: The attribute contains a unique identifier for the modified version of the pdf and corresponding xfdf document. The modified attribute corresponds to the changing identifier that is based on the file's contents at the time it was last updated. The value shall be a hexadecimal number. A common value for this is an MD5 checksum.

member.name: M:iText.Forms.Xfdf.IdsObject.GetOriginal
member.summary: Gets the string value of the permanent identifier which is based on the contents of the file at the time it was originally created.
member.remarks: Gets the string value of the permanent identifier which is based on the contents of the file at the time it was originally created. This value does not change when the file is incrementally updated. The value shall be a hexadecimal number.

member.name: M:iText.Forms.Xfdf.IdsObject.SetOriginal(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the string value of the permanent identifier which is based on the contents of the file at the time it was originally created.
member.remarks: Sets the string value of the permanent identifier which is based on the contents of the file at the time it was originally created. This value does not change when the file is incrementally updated. The value shall be a hexadecimal number. A common value for this is an MD5 checksum.
member.param: the permanent identifier value

member.name: M:iText.Forms.Xfdf.IdsObject.GetModified
member.summary: Gets the string value of the unique identifier for the modified version of the pdf and corresponding xfdf document.
member.remarks: Gets the string value of the unique identifier for the modified version of the pdf and corresponding xfdf document. The modified attribute corresponds to the changing identifier that is based on the file's contents at the time it was last updated. The value shall be a hexadecimal number.

member.name: M:iText.Forms.Xfdf.IdsObject.SetModified(System.String)
